docs.snippet: In “Winners Take All,” Anand Giridharadas explores a global elite that bemoans the state of the world while refusing to seek real, structural change.

headline.main: Meet the ‘Change Agents’ Who Are Enabling Inequality

docs.snippet: When low-income families face difficult legal disputes, most cannot afford a lawyer. A small change in tax policy could solve this problem, an economist says.

headline.main: How Rising Inequality Has Widened the Justice Gap

docs.snippet: A complex, empathetic docu-series from the maker of “Hoop Dreams” shows how racial imbalances persist, even in an integrated, progressive school.

docs.snippet: The National Academy of Social Insurance writes that the country has made no progress in reducing disparities in income and wealth.

New technologies from artificial intelligence to gene editing hold immense potential to improve people's live — but can also drive greater inequality and social dislocation, according to a U.N. report launched Monday.

headline.main: UN Report: Technologies Can Help Lives but Boost Inequality

docs.snippet: It's wrong to say good parents raise successful kids and bad parents raise unsuccessful ones. The story is more complicated than that.
The Facebook co-founder’s rise was meteoric. He argues that the same forces that helped him succeed have made it harder for others. In a new book, “Fair Shot,” he proposes a bold solution.

headline.print_headline: Inequality: A Secret  To His Success
